intro: Conostylis setigera subsp. dasys, commonly known as the narrow-leafed conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in a spike-like inflorescence. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Conostylis setigera subsp. dasys is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem.
